other_tests.findings: The gallbladder is distended with gallbladder wall edema and thickening. There is layered biliary sludge within the gallbladder with calculi noted at the gallbladder neck and within the proximal cystic duct. Periportal edema is noted within the liver. There is arterial phase hyperenhancement surrounding the gallbladder consistent with transient perfusion. There are two subcentimeter T2 hyperintense cystic lesions in the liver likely representing biliary hamartomas. There is a 3.9 x 3.4-cm saccular aneurysm of the infrarenal abdominal aorta. Multiple T2 hyperintense lesions throughout the spleen consistent with hemangiomas. The spleen is mildly enlarged. There are simple cysts within both kidneys.
